result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas L Longacre

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court, in custody, with attorney Nick Martinez for Jess Martinez.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The charge is dismissed and read into 15CM820, 15CM1752 and 15CM937  Calendar call scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing at 11-30-2015 03:30 pm

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez for Jess Martinez.   Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Martinez advises the Court the Defendant has recently been charged on 15CM2126 and requesting additional time for negotiations on the other case.  The Court sets the matter for another jury status prior to the trial.  Attorney Martinez requests the Court modify the bail to include Huber bailee status with SCRAM monitoring.  The State objects to the bail motion.  The Court denies the request for bail modification.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on:  11/24/15.
Jury trial - 12 person at 12-01-2015 08:30 am
Jury status hearing at 11-24-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Kristi J Gordon appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State has just received a new referral. State had a global resolution on all the cases that will change the offer now.  Defense requests to enter a plea today. Court will pass the matter. Case recalled. State addresses the global offer. OWI 2nd addressed. Defense responds. Defense requests another date to review the new OWI case. Court will adjourn the trial. Court will give another jury status/jury trial date on 15CM813. Cases 15CM820, 15CM937 and 15CM1752 to trail along.  Amended Complaint to be filed on 10/12/1015 in file 15CM820.  Jury status hearing scheduled for November 24, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 10/8/15 and 10/13/15.
Jury trial - 12 person at 10-13-2015 08:30 am
Jury status hearing at 10-08-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has a new case - 15CM1752. Parties are going to work out a global offer. Defense requests the trial date be removed and these matters be set for plea sentencing date in two weeks. Court will reschedule 15CM813 to a new jury status/jury trial date and 15CM820, 15CM937 and 15CM1752 to trail along. Defense requests to address bail on all of defendant's files. Court grants request. Defense is requesting huber bailee status on all four files - 15CM813, 15CM820, 15CM937 and 15CM1752. State takes no position. Court grants huber bailee status.  Jury status hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Request for adjournment filed by plaintiff.
Reviewed by Judge Aprahamian - address at status hearing.
Filed by the State. Witness list attached.
Jury trial - 12 person on September 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Jury status hearing on September 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness or co-actors  listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court with attorney Jess Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense states these cases may resolve if there is a global offer, but requests a date for jury status/jury trial on 15CM813. Bail addressed on 15CM813. Bail addressed. Court sets bail to $500.00 signature bond with same conditions.  Jury status hearing scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on August 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court quashes warrant. Court orders bail reinstated(not forfeited). Defendant needs to post bail on this matter (15CM813) if not already posted. Atty. Martinez to investigate the bail on this matter (15CM813).  Defense requests another date on all matters. Court will give another date in 30 days.  Hearing scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Br. 9 only
Notice of Bail/Bond Forfeiture  **no paper copy in physical file**

Attorney Jess Martinez in court.   Defendant Thomas L Longacre did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense has no indication of their clients whereabouts today. Court revokes and forfeits bail and issues a capias - Br. 9 only.
Hearing on July 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Withdrawn per Atty Martinez on 6/9/15.  Wants to keep defendant's cases together.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to possess any knives/weapons/firearms.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness or co-actors  listed in the Criminal Complaint. Bail has already been posted.

Defendant Thomas L Longacre in court with attorney Nicholas Martinez.  Attorney appears as friend of the court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
